Argument: Statement1: To reduce waste of raw materials, the government of sperland is considering requiring household appliances to be broken down for salvage when discarded. Statement2: To cover the cost of salvage, the government is planning to charge a fee, which would be imposed when the appliance is first sold.
Premise1: Increasing the cost of disposing of an appliance properly increases the incentive to dispose of it improperly.
Premise2: Many nonfunctioning appliances that are currently discarded could be repaired at relatively little expense.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: To reduce waste of raw materials, the government of sperland is considering requiring household appliances to be broken down for salvage when discarded. Imposing the fee at the time of salvage won't reduce waste more effectively, however, because if customers tend to keep old appliances longer they are faced with a higher cost of repairs. Statement2: To cover the cost of salvage, the government is planning to charge a fee, which would be imposed when the appliance is first sold.

input_info.Q: Which of the following, if true, most seriously weakens the argument?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Many nonfunctioning appliances that are currently discarded could be repaired at relatively little expense.
input_info.O: Premise1: Increasing the cost of disposing of an appliance properly increases the incentive to dispose of it improperly.

Imposing the fee at the time of salvage would reduce waste more effectively, however, because consumers tend to keep old appliances longer if they are faced with a fee for discarding them. Statement2: To cover the cost of salvage, the government is planning to charge a fee, which would be imposed when the appliance is first sold.

Argument: Statement1: A company that manufactures plastic products from recyclable plastic is, surprisingly, unconcerned that economic conditions may worsen, despite analysts'belief that consumers would then consider ecofriendly plastic products an expensive luxury. Statement2: But the company reasons that it will be able to lower its prices because, in a weakenedeconomy, other ecofriendly plastic manufacturers are likely to fail. Statement3: Demand among manufacturers for recyclable plastics as raw materials would then plummet, creating an oversupply of such materials, making them less expensive for the manufacturer to purchase and thus lowering the company's costs.
Premise1: Consumers would likely soon learn of the oversupply of recyclable plastics and cease recycling them, significantly raising manufacturers' raw-material costs.
Premise2: Retailers, including retailers that cater to consumers seeking certain types of ecofriendly products, may lose some business if economic conditions worsen.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: A company that manufactures plastic products from recyclable plastic is, surprisingly, unconcerned that economic conditions may worsen, despite analysts'belief that consumers would then consider ecofriendly plastic products an expensive luxury. Statement2: But the company reasons that it will be able to attract more customersbecause, in a weakenedeconomy, other ecofriendly plastic manufacturers are likely to fail. Statement3: Some retailers that demand ecofriendly plastic products would seek cooperations with the company.

input_info.Q: Which of the following, if true, most weakens the company's reasoning?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Retailers, including retailers that cater to consumers seeking certain types of ecofriendly products, may lose some business if economic conditions worsen.

Argument: Statement1: The effort involved in lying produces measurable physiological reactions such as a speedup of the heartbeat. Statement2: Since lying is accompanied by physiological reactions, lie-detector tests that can detect these reactions are a sure way of determining when someone is lying.
Premise1: For people who are not lying, the tension of taking a lie-detector test can produce physiological reactions identical to the ones that accompany the act of lying.
Premise2: People are often unaware that they are having physiological reactions of the sort measured by lie-detector tests.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: The effort involved in lying produces measurable physiological reactions such as a speedup of the heartbeat. Statement2: Since lying is accompanied by physiological reactions and people can control their physiological response by becoming aware of it,lie-detector tests that can detect these reactions are not a sure way of determining when someone is lying.

input_info.Q: Which one of the following statements, if true, most seriously weakens the argument?
input_info.Om: Premise2: People are often unaware that they are having physiological reactions of the sort measured by lie-detector tests.
input_info.O: Premise1: For people who are not lying, the tension of taking a lie-detector test can produce physiological reactions identical to the ones that accompany the act of lying.
input_info.P: Statement1: The effort involved in lying produces measurable physiological reactions such as a speedup of the heartbeat. Statement2: Since lying is accompanied by physiological reactions, lie-detector tests that can detect these reactions are a sure way of determining when someone is lying.

Argument: Statement1: Prolonged exposure to sulfur fumes permanently damages one's sense of smell. Statement2: In one important study, 100 workers from sulfur-emitting factories and a control group of 100 workers from other occupations were asked to identify a variety of chemically reproduced scents, including those of foods, spices, and flowers. Premise2: Every sulfur-emitting factory with workers participating in the study also emits other noxious fumes.

On average, the factory workers successfully identified 10 percent of the scents compared to 50 percent for the control group.

Argument: Statement1: Today's farmers plant only a handful of different strains of a given crop. Statement2: Crops lack the diversity that they had only a few generations ago. Statement3: Hence, a disease that strikes only a few strains of crops, and that would have had only minor impact on the food supply in the past, would devastate it today.
Premise1: Affected crops can quickly be replaced from seed banks that store many strains of those crops.
Premise2: Humans today have more variety in their diets than in the past, but still rely heavily on cereal crops like rice and wheat.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: Today's farmers plant many different strains of a given crop. Statement2: Crops had the diversity that they hadn't only a few generations ago. Statement3: Hence, traditional cereal crops like rice and wheat are not important today.

input_info.Q: Which one of the following, if true, would most weaken the argument?

Argument: Statement1: A scientist made three observations : ( 1 ) in the world's temperate zones, food is more plentiful in the ocean than it is in fresh water ; ( 2 ) migratory fish in temperate zones generally mature in the ocean and spawn in fresh water ; and ( 3 ) migratory fish need much nourishment as they mature but little or none during the part of their lives when they spawn. Statement2: On the basis of those observations, the scientist formulated the hypothesis that food availability is a determining factor in the migration of migratory fish. Statement3: Subsequently the scientist learned that in the tropics migratory fish generally mature in fresh water and spawn in the ocean.

Argument: Statement1: In the nation of partoria, large trucks currently account for 6 percent of miles driven on partoria's roads but are involved in 12 percent of all highway fatalities. The very largest trucks-those with three trailers-had less than a third of the accident rate of single- and double-trailer trucks. Statement2: Clearly, therefore, one way for partoria to reduce highway deaths would be to require shippers to increase their use of triple-trailer trucks.
Premise1: So far only the best, most experienced drivers for partorian trucking companies have been driving triple-trailer trucks.
Premise2: Very few fatal collisions involving trucks in partoria are collisions between two trucks.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: In the nation of partoria, large trucks currently account for 6 percent of miles driven on partoria's roads but are involved in 12 percent of all highway fatalities. But almost in every cases, the drivers of large trucks drive trucks normally. Statement3: Although so, someone still suggests that one way for partoria to reduce highway deaths would be to require shippers to decrease their use of large trucks.

input_info.Q: Which of the following, if true, most seriously weakens the argument?

input_info.O: Premise1: So far only the best, most experienced drivers for partorian trucking companies have been driving triple-trailer trucks.

Argument: Statement1: Overexposure to certain wavelengths of strong sunlight is the main cause of melanoma, a virulent form of skin cancer. Statement2: For this reason, doctors now urge everyone to put adequate sunblock on skin exposed to strong sunlight.

Premise2: There are people who have allergic reactions to certain chemicals found in many sunblocks.

Statement2: For this reason, doctors now urge everyone to put adequate sunblock on skin exposed to strong sunlight.

input_info.Om: Premise2: There are people who have allergic reactions to certain chemicals found in many sunblocks.
input_info.O: Premise1: There is no evidence that there are wavelengths of sunlight that lead to both sunburn and melanoma.
input_info.P: Statement1: Overexposure to certain wavelengths of strong sunlight is the main cause of melanoma, a virulent form of skin cancer. Adequate sunblock, according to doctors, is any preparation that prevents sunburn even if the person is exposed to strong sunlight for a significant length of time. Statement2: For this reason, doctors now urge everyone to put adequate sunblock on skin exposed to strong sunlight.

Argument: Statement1: Long-term and short-term relaxation training are two common forms of treatment for individuals experiencing problematic levels of anxiety. Statement2: Yet studies show that on average, regardless of which form of treatment one receives, symptoms of anxiety decrease to a normal level within the short-term-training time period. Statement3: Thus, for most people the generally more expensive long-term training is unwarranted.
Premise1: Recipients of long-term training are much less likely than recipients of short-term training to have recurrences of problematic levels of anxiety.
Premise2: A decrease in symptoms of anxiety often occurs even with no treatment or intervention by a mental health professional.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: Long-term and short-term relaxation training are two common forms of treatment for individuals experiencing problematic levels of anxiety. Statement2: Yet studies show that on average, if one received a longer the relaxation training, symptoms of anxiety decrease to a normal level within a shorter time. Statement3: Thus, for most people the generally more expensive long-term training is necessary.

input_info.Q: Which one of the following, if true, most weakens the argument?
input_info.Om: Premise2: A decrease in symptoms of anxiety often occurs even with no treatment or intervention by a mental health professional.
input_info.O: Premise1: Recipients of long-term training are much less likely than recipients of short-term training to have recurrences of problematic levels of anxiety.
input_info.P: Statement1: Long-term and short-term relaxation training are two common forms of treatment for individuals experiencing problematic levels of anxiety. Statement2: Yet studies show that on average, regardless of which form of treatment one receives, symptoms of anxiety decrease to a normal level within the short-term-training time period. Statement3: Thus, for most people the generally more expensive long-term training is unwarranted.

Argument: Statement1: There is no reason why the work of scientists has to be officially confirmed before being published. Statement2: There is a system in place for the confirmation or disconfirmation of scientific findings, namely, the replication of results by other scientists. Poor scientific work on the part of any one scientist, which can include anything from careless reporting practices to fraud, is not harmful. Statement3: It will be exposed and rendered harmless when other scientists conduct the experiments and obtain disconfirmatory results.
Premise1: Scientific experiments can go unchallenged for many years before they are replicated.
Premise2: Most scientists work as part of a team rather than alone.

Please write the modified argument below:
output: Statement1: The work of scientists has to be officially confirmed before being published. Statement2: There is no system in place for the confirmation or disconfirmation of scientific findings, only by accepting official tests can they be verified by other scientists. Poor scientific work on the part of any one scientist, which can include anything from careless reporting practices to fraud, is going to be tested. Statement4: Without access to fellow scientists, it only will be exposed when other scientists officially conduct the experiments and obtain disconfirmatory results.

input_info.Q: Which one of the following, if true, would weaken the argument?
input_info.Om: Premise2: Most scientists work as part of a team rather than alone.
input_info.O: Premise1: Scientific experiments can go unchallenged for many years before they are replicated.
input_info.P: Statement1: There is no reason why the work of scientists has to be officially confirmed before being published. Statement2: There is a system in place for the confirmation or disconfirmation of scientific findings, namely, the replication of results by other scientists. Poor scientific work on the part of any one scientist, which can include anything from careless reporting practices to fraud, is not harmful. Statement3: It will be exposed and rendered harmless when other scientists conduct the experiments and obtain disconfirmatory results.
